64667181.review:
Yuzusoft's Sanoba Witch took me completely by surprise when I picked it up on a whim early last year. With its strong characters, top-notch presentation, great sense of childish humour, and it's surprisingly emotional storylines, I fell in love, and shortly after that began the wait for the now released Senren*Banka! So the question is, does it live up to the former release? My answer is, in many ways, yes! However, in one way, I simply find it a bit lacking in comparison (which may or may not be an issue depending on what you expect).

First of all, the comedy is absolutely on-point. Just like Sanoba Witch, Yuzusoft's perfected brand of perverse juvenile humour really shines through, bringing life to the characters in a way that other VNs often fail to do. The characters themselves are strong & wonderfully voiced, although perhaps a bit too similar in the romance scenes with our rather likeable protagonist, but the humour & general writing more makes up for that somewhat minor shortcoming.

The story itself is interestingly ridiculous, which is exactly what I'd hope for from a lighthearted playful read like this, but that does bring me nicely to my one subjectively negative comparison to Sanoba Witch: Senren*Banka, in my experience, quite a bit less emotionally charged than Sanoba Witch, which repeatedly caught me off-guard with its surprisingly touching story & heartfelt moments.  It's not that S*B is completely devoid of them, with Murasame's route being an obvious exception to me, but unlike Sanoba Witch, it's the exception, rather than the norm. 

On a few perhaps brighter notes, the art is absolutely top notch, with the varied facial expressions changing constantly mid-sentence to breathe real life in to the characters. Not only that, but the OST is also very enjoyable, with its traditional sounding pieces really adding to the title wonderfully, although it's perhaps the lovingly performed piano ballads that really stand out the most for me.

From a tech POV, I can't help but be impressed. Being able to jump seamlessly between lines of text/VA, instant choice skipping, and the best auto-mode I've seen in a VN made this a pleasure to read from start to finish. Also, as you'd expect, Nekonyan's localisation work is absolutely on point, with the translation being fluid with less mistakes than I've been able to notice on one hand throughout my read.

In conclusion, it's a damn fine moege that perhaps lacks the emotional punch of its previously translated sister title, but still nails every other element wonderfully, and so, I'd be glad to recommend it to anyone who just wants to relax with a lighthearted tale & lovable comedy. With more Yuzusoft titles on the way, now's a great time to jump in & see what all the fuss is about.

(Note: While I did get a review copy for free, I was fully intent on supporting the release on day one, so I did a giveaway of the copy I would've bought through our Steam group. I'd like to think my review is in no way coloured by how I obtained my copy seeing as how I bought a copy anyway, but I feel that transparency is important, so take from that what you will).

64655574.review:
[h2]Senren * Banka[/h2]
[i]Cutting into the strings of fate.[/i]

[h3]Preclaimer[/h3]
- This is an Adult Visual Novel - one with a free R18 Patch (obtainable at NekoNyan's webshop) at that - designed to be R18, which is why I consider the R18 content part of the whole and will include it in this review. If for whatever reason you are not interested in this content, or aren't legally allowed to play it, you should just skip this review.
- Since many Visual Novels are similar in a bunch of ways, I'm gonna review this one on a few common aspects, including heavy reference to the previous title from YuzuSoft as well as independent explanations.

[hr]
[h3]Graphical & Technical Quality[/h3]
Have you played the previous title, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/0256667/recommended/888790/]Sabbat of the Witch[/url]? If so, this makes it easy. If not - let's just cut it short, you should do so right away. Senren * Banka's story does not require any knowledge from Sanoba Witch, but with it being the next title from the very same developer, it is very similar (and does contain very funny joke references you only understand that way) - and Sanoba Witch is even better.
Anyway, as to be expected from YuzuSoft, Senren * Banka features amazing quality in both graphics and technical features. You get the whole spectrum from Sanoba Witch, alongside some cool newcomers and enhancements.
Such as the KiriKiri engine default features like dozens of saveslots, skipping back and forth throughout the story (as far as you have already seen it once), costumization for menu voices, skip mode behaviour, text colors, fonts and so on.
The cool additions back in Sanoba Witch like saving voicelines to rehear them whenever you wanna hear your favorite "Baka baaaaka!" again, mouse gestures, the option to add even more saveslots and so on.
And finally all the cool new gimmicks Senren * Banka brings to the table, like detailed backwards skipping, quick chapter jumping, customizable keyboard shortcuts, a customizable menu bar, being able to jump to the scene of a saved voiceline, a more user friendly savegame manager and finally - the flowchart diagram, the easiest way ever to keep track of every story segment, find out what you're missing and as easy as ever build your new route for a new playthrough.
Also, with the hidden "Advanced settings" menu you can now feel like a pro, adjusting stuff like render methods, cache sizes and all that juicy expert stuff.

As with Sanoba Witch there are no character sprite animations (like blinking or moving mouths) but the various character sprites are vividly used and changed mid-sentence to bring the scene to life.

Though, also like with the previous game, Senren * Banka features a few textual errors in the translation here and there, but nothing too disturbing.
And Senren * Banka seems to have some technical hicups too, atleast the reaction of the mouse gestures is far worse.

[hr]
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2034918446[/url]

[hr]
[h3]Content & Runtime[/h3]
Of course not spoiling anything on the actual story, Senren * Banka is much more of a casual, ecchi humor RomCom than it's predecessor focussing more on - stuff that the romance and adult genre entail. So if you are looking for a serious, deep, heartfelt story giving you an emotional journey of your lifetime - I again highly recommend the predecessor, Sabbat of the Witch. Though if you are looking for a good laugh amongst some good looking virtual characters making out, this is one of the best things you could get.

Senren * Banka features the usual 4 main routes (without a real "main" route like Sanoba Witch) with an additional bonus route (shorter in comparison) splitting between the two side characters, which gives a total of 7 ("bad" ending included) endings on 5 routes to enjoy. The Prologue/Common route takes around 10h of time, the main routes around 15h each and the bonus route around 10h whole (as always measured by not rush-skipping standards), totaling to around 80h.
The characters are well developed and distinct, giving lot's of variation to enjoy no matter which route you play, though the male protagonist has been reduced to your everyday anime protagonist again (even though he looks exactly like the one from Sanoba Witch :I).

As this again is a full fledged Visual Novel with multiple routes/endings, you determine your path with the 8(+1) in-dialog-decisions made throughout the story, with some of them having more than the regular 2 options and some of them even leading to different event-paths right on the common route.

If you're not after your personal Waifu I'd recommend playing the routes in the order they are displayed (flowchart menu, shoppage description, ...) for maximum effect.

After clearing your first playthrough you unlock the gallery, where you can enjoy the 93 wallpaper CGs, 30 (somewhat animated) SD Chibi arts, 53 really awesome soundtracks and 7 opening/ending movies (as long as you saw/heared them once before of course), neatly sorted by category and character.
There also are After Stories again, which contain another bonus scene for every character whose route you already cleared.

Upon clearing all routes you unlock the Sprite Viewer too, where you can play around with all the backgrounds and character sprites in all their variations to your heart's content, and even load custom backgrounds for all your photoshop needs.

[hr]
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2027016060[/url]

[hr]
[h3]The R18 content[/h3]
Considering the content is for free, you can still expect an experience worthy of any regular full price R18 DLC. Each main character comes with 3+1 hentai scenes, each bonus character with 2+1.
Great voice acting alongside missing weird sound effects (you know, those weird "break bones" and "mix cement" sounds you often hear) and CG backgrounds with high variety make up for the previously mentioned  lack of animation and the likes.
When it comes to the depictions of bodily fluids and the will and stamina of the participants, it's noteably more than with the predecessor, but nothing out of the ordinary hentai and even varies strongly from route to route.

Senren * Banka does a slight serving on fetish play, with the concept of "turning into sex crazy monsters" and that peeing fetish thingie being a thing to look out for.

You get to choose between coming inside or outside in most occasions, with personal preference (aka. auto choice) to be set in the settings.

And again there is your best buddy, the panic button, customizable in function (minimize, placeholder image, custom image).

Also, as is suitable for having a foreign character on board, you even get a free lesson on "Japanese for Beginners - Hentai Edition".

[b]As usual (sadly) mosaic censorship on the 'good' bits is in place.[/b]

[hr]
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2011875313[/url]

[hr]
[h3]Conclusion[/h3]
Is this game worth it?
Well, if I'd go and rate it on a simplistic scale from 1 to 10, with 12 being where the predecessor managed to land, I'd give Senren * Banka an overall 9/10, depending on personal taste.
If you played and enjoyed the predecessor (or any other VN of the same caliber) for it's rich, deep and serious story, this here might not be the thing for you. If you don't mind or are actively looking for a nice, lighthearted RomCom with adult content, Senren * Banka is well invested money.
Also, if you're still unsure - there will always be a next sale.

- Gameplay: A game with multiple choices/ endings. There are a very useful built-in flowchart. 
- VA: Yes, excepts MC
- Artwork: very good. Censored with 18+ patch available at publisher website.
- Text/translation: good.
- Soundtrack: good.
- Performance: no problems so far.

Conclusion: Senren * Banka is a long length vn with fantasy/Romance/SoL elements published by Nekonyan with excellent artwork, voice acting, multiple endings. Recommended by those that like fantasy/Romance themed game.

63866872.review:
-Story: 6/10
The story is very generic with very convenient solutions. This leads to very little or short tension in the story. The common route is like a basic essay assigned to and written by a middle schooler. The branching routes let you explore the heroines and learn more about the curse from different perspectives. The branching routes are different in that they offer more insight into the lore of the legend, which i liked. However, how you "hook-up" with each heroine has exactly the same format. Which cheapens the replayability. 

-ART: 10/10 
The characters look great and the facial reactions do a great job portraying their reactions. I'm mostly impressed with the backgrounds. There's so much detail in most scenes that my eyes can help but explore.

-Music: 9/10
The music is very enjoyable and there are a few that I wouldn't mind playing on repeat on my playlist.

TLDR: Game has good art and music. Story is terribly boring and how you get with each girl is exactly the same: spend some time with her, they realize their feeling, confess, then sex in that exact order.

63655715.review:
I hesitated to write a review right after this game launched on Steam, since I didn't finish Roka and Koharu routes when I played the Japanese version. I did play through the four main routes, though, so after giving it some thought I decided to write a review anyway.

Senren＊Banka is a great game. The art is top-notch (also the first 1080P title by Yuzusoft), the cast beats out just about any other game's in terms of talent and experience, and the tracks include quite a few memorable ones, especially the opening theme song, Koikou Enishi. Each of the four main routes also manages to tell an engaging story, with Lena's route being the closest to the core plot of the game, which comes off as a surprise given her role as a foreign student in the village. On top of all that, Yuzusoft's customized Kirikiri engine famously provides for a highly configurable and enjoyable gaming experience.

In short, this game is well worth its price tag, with or without discount - you won't regret buying it, period. Buying it will also support NekoNyan in their quest to introduce more high quality VNs to the western market - especially given the incredibly exciting news that they have now convinced and partnered with another great VN developer SAGA PLANETS to publish an English version of Kin'iro Loveriche, SAGA PLANETS's 2017 work that was so successful in Japan it prompted them to make their first fan disk in over a decade. I can't wait for the day when all of the great games made by Yuzusoft and SAGA PLANETS receive the renown they deserve by fans all around the world. (Sorry for using this review to blatantly lobby NekoNyan for more SAGA PLANETS titles; as a devout fan of SAGA PLANETS and especially of Karumaruka＊Circle, I couldn't resist. Both Yuzusoft and SAGA PLANETS are located in Osaka, and they often ran joint campaigns to promote each other's works, so hopefully this little bit of digression can be forgiven.)

63550850.review:
I am absolutely in love with Senren Banka. I just finished playing my first Playthrough which was Murasames Route and there isnt a single thing I didnt like. The Characters are all fleshed out perfectly and all have their own little querks and stories. The VN itself has the common route where the game mainly focuses on the supernatural mixed together with comedy parts and has a more relaxed feel to it. After you start going to the specific Character Routes however you get a lot more Character development of the specific character and a lot more Romance. The Game also gets a lot more realistic and doesnt focus on the supernatural anymore, but more on actual problems. Just the fact that it nearly took me 15 hours for a single Playthrough and I didnt get bored a single time should tell you that the Game has a great flow and development. It never stretches the story to make it get boring and it never feels rushed.

You can also clearly tell that they put a lot of work in this Games technical Development as the Art and Sprites are all amazing. The Soundtrack is also great and they even added nice little extras like a Storytree where you can always see how your Story is progressing and even jump back to specific points in the story. This makes it very convenient when it comes to changing between Routes. The Translation and Writing  is also very polished and you can tell that they really took their time with it to get as many funny parts in and to make it as realistic as possible.

Overall I really can only say that you should try the game out for yourself and that you really should support the Developer and the publisher as they are both doing an amazing job especially if you consider how much work they put into this and how cheap the Games they offer are. The 30 Euro are so worth it when you compare them to other Visual Novels and I can only recommend checking out the other VNs Yuzusoft has created as they are all amazing.

Thank you for the Key NekoNyan as well really appreciate it :)

Score: 10/10

63526137.review:
I have so far completed Yoshsino, Murasame, and Koharu's routes. First playthrough took about 24 hours. The common route took me about 12 hours to complete, each main character route seems to be about 10 hours ± 2 hours, while the side heroine routes (only did Koharu's so far) took about 4-5 hours. 

So far I am extremely happy with my purchase of this game. The art and character designs are phenomenal in my opinion and the music does a great job of setting the tone of the scene and really drawing you into the atmosphere of the story.

The comedy in the game was a great distraction from my loneliness on Valentines Day and kept me laughing for a large portion of what I read so far. The scenarios were also made very believable by the writing in the story. Though, I am usually a laid back reader, so if something is "bad writing" I wouldn't really care or be able to tell unless it really stood out.

The romance in the game was very well done, felt believably, and had really sweet moments too. At the moment, Murasame is best girl for me, but both Yoshino's and Murasame's routes were very good, and handled the drama/struggles aspects well. In Koharu's route, I also liked the [spoiler]love triangle that ensued between her and Roka; I thought it was cool to see the interactions between them.[/spoiler]

Lastly, the technical features of the game are superb, some of the best I have seen in a visual novel, and I have read many. There is a voice bookmark feature which is improved from their previous novel, a customizable menu bar (the bar that is at the bottom of the text box), and bindable keybinds, which is rare (in my experience) to see in a visual novel.

So far this has been a great vn, and I don't regret buying it. I greatly enjoy the characters, story, setting, and fantasy aspect. 

If you are still hesitant, try out the free demo first, and if you decide to get it, you can copy the data in the Trial Version savedata folder (can be found in Steam\userdata\[your user id]\1221010) [b]before[/b] buying the game, then pasting the saves into the main game save folder (Steam\userdata\[user id]\1144400) in order to keep your old data, or you can just skip through until you get where you left off in the Trial Version (change ctrl skip from skip only "read text" to skip "unread text" in order to skip without needing to rapidly smash the spacebar or enter key).

63479438.review:
[h1][b]"It's a safe choice for anime visual novel fans! ヽ(=´▽`=)ﾉ"[/b][/h1]
[b]+ Point : Don't miss the free extra patch officially provided![/b]

Senren＊Banka. This is an anime visual novel developed by Yuzusoft and published by Nekonyan. The original released in 2016(Japan) and also awarded the 2016 Moe Game Award for the second tier. (As you may know, the best visual novel of that year was awarded to WAGAMAMA HIGH SPEC.) Anyway, when we talk about Yuzusoft games, we will generally agree that their games are a safe choice. Their work has provided a certain level of quality, and has given great pleasure to Japanese anime VN fans.

This game well follows the typical features of Yuzusoft. It features romance comedy story lines, full voice supported, attractive heroines, nice sub-characters, cute artworks, vibrant animations, and the free extra uncensored patch. Of course, there are some differences in detail. It took place in a mix of historical and modern fantasy settings. And your relationship with heroines are already fixed to some degree. Especially this game has some swallow holes in the story plot. It gives the impression that some processes have been omitted. If you are insensitive to those things, this game can still bring you a lot of laughter and fun.

[b]Pros (+) & Cons (-) [/b]
[table]
[td][list]
[*][+] Fully voiced
[*][+] Nice soundtracks
[*][+] Colorful animations
[*][+] Attractive characters
[/list][/td]
[td][list]
[*][-] Minor Bugs
[*][-] Slow Pacing
[*][-] Shallow Plot
[*][-] 
[/list][/td]
[/table]

[b]Verdict: Game 8.5/10, Translation 10/10[/b]
Senren＊Banka. This is definitely a Yuzusoft style visual novel. It focuses on the romance comedy theme and features outstanding anime artwork and voice dubbing. In addition, NekoNyan's global localization quality is so good that it's very comfortable to read. Some glitches exist, but not enough to worry about. One thing not to miss is Yuzusoft's previous game characters appearing as cameos in the background. Discovering that will be another fun part of this visual novel. Recommended!
